Razumihin paced excitedly. 

“Let’s borrow from my uncle,” he said. 

“Why?” Raskolnikov asked. 

“He has a thousand roubles. He wants to help!” 

Raskolnikov frowned. “What’s the plan?” 

Razumihin grinned. “We’ll start a publishing business. They’re clueless!” 

“Clueless?” Raskolnikov repeated. 

“Most publishers don’t know their books! We can profit!” 

“Are you sure?” Raskolnikov questioned, doubt creeping in. 

“Absolutely! We’ll work hard, you, me, and Dounia.” 

Razumihin’s enthusiasm was infectious. 

“Let’s seize this chance,” he urged. 

Raskolnikov nodded slowly. “Alright, let’s do it.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Razumihin proposes a publishing partnership, leveraging borrowed money to capitalize on the potential profitability of the book market.
